com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.oceanspi

Interface OceanSPI


  • public interface OceanSPI
    SPI for master duplex and slave configuration.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBusControllerMode(int busIndex)
      When in master mode, SPI transfers are controlled via OBP Messages When in slave mode, the device responds to OBP messages.
      int getBusTransferMode(int busIndex, int chipIndex)
      This is the clock phase and polarity setting. 0: The clock idles low; data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 1: The clock idles low; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock 2: The clock idles high, the data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 3: The clock idles high; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock
      int getBusWaitStateDelay(int busIndex)
      Master mode only.
      int getChipSelectDelay(int busIndex)
      Master mode only.
      int getMaxMasterFrequency(int busIndex)
      Get Maximum master frequency
      int getMaxSlaveFrequency(int busIndex)
      Get Maximum slave frequency
      int getNumberOfBuses()
      Get number of SPI buses available on device.
      int getNumberOfChipSelects(int busIndex)
      Get number of SPI chip selects for a particular bus.
      int getPolarity(int busIndex, int chipIndex)
      This is the chip select polarity setting. 0: Chip select is active low 1: Chip select is active high
      byte[] getSPIBytes(byte[] message, int length)
      Sends a packet of bytes over the SPI bus and read the result.
      void saveSPISettings()
      Save SPI settings to persistent storage.
      void setBusControllerMode(int busIndex, int busMode)
      Mode 0: Disabled (Default State) Mode 1: Master Mode 2: Slave
      void setBusTransferMode(int busIndex, int chipIndex, int transferMode)
      This is the clock phase and polarity setting. 0: The clock idles low; data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 1: The clock idles low; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock 2: The clock idles high, the data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 3: The clock idles high; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock
      void setBusWaitStateDelay(int busIndex, int period)
      Master mode only.
      void setChipSelectDelay(int busIndex, int delay)
      Master mode only.
      void setClockSpeed(int busIndex, int speed)
      Set SPI Clock frequency in HZ.
      void setPolarity(int busIndex, int chipIndex, int polarity)
      This is the chip select polarity setting. 0: Chip select is active low 1: Chip select is active high

    • Method Detail

      • getSPIBytes

        byte[] getSPIBytes(byte[] message,
                   int length)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a packet of bytes over the SPI bus and read the result.
        Parameters:
        message - Sequence of bytes to send over the bus.
        length - of message.
        Returns:
        After writing to SPI, the spectrometer immediately reads from it. The resulting Byte array is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the command cannot be sent to the device.

      • getNumberOfBuses

        int getNumberOfBuses()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Get number of SPI buses available on device.
        Returns:
        number of buses
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • getBusControllerMode

        int getBusControllerMode(int busIndex)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        When in master mode, SPI transfers are controlled via OBP Messages When in slave mode, the device responds to OBP messages. In this mode, the master must poll the device for messages responses periodically.
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • getBusTransferMode

        int getBusTransferMode(int busIndex,
                       int chipIndex)
                throws java.io.IOException
        This is the clock phase and polarity setting. 0: The clock idles low; data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 1: The clock idles low; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock 2: The clock idles high, the data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 3: The clock idles high; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        chipIndex -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • getPolarity

        int getPolarity(int busIndex,
                int chipIndex)
         throws java.io.IOException
        This is the chip select polarity setting. 0: Chip select is active low 1: Chip select is active high
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        chipIndex -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • getChipSelectDelay

        int getChipSelectDelay(int busIndex)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Master mode only. This is the chip select delay control. 0-63: Number of SPI clocks that will be inserted between the chip select active edge and the first SPI clock edge.
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • getBusWaitStateDelay

        int getBusWaitStateDelay(int busIndex)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Master mode only. This is the SPI sample period value 0-32767: Number of wait states to be inserted between data transfers. During the idle period chip select will be de-activated.
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • setClockSpeed

        void setClockSpeed(int busIndex,
                   int speed)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Set SPI Clock frequency in HZ. Master Mode Only.
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        speed -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • setBusTransferMode

        void setBusTransferMode(int busIndex,
                        int chipIndex,
                        int transferMode)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This is the clock phase and polarity setting. 0: The clock idles low; data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 1: The clock idles low; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock 2: The clock idles high, the data is valid on the leading edge of the clock 3: The clock idles high; the data is valid on the trailing edge of the clock
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        chipIndex -
        transferMode -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

        void setChipSelectDelay(int busIndex,
                        int delay)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Master mode only. This is the chip select delay control. 0-63: Number of SPI clocks that will be inserted between the chip select active edge and the first SPI clock edge.

        delay -

      • setBusWaitStateDelay

        void setBusWaitStateDelay(int busIndex,
                          int period)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Master mode only. This is the SPI sample period value 0-32767: Number of wait states to be inserted between data transfers. During the idle period chip select will be de-activated.
        Parameters:
        busIndex -
        period -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.

      • saveSPISettings

        void saveSPISettings()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Save SPI settings to persistent storage. The current settings will become the new power on default.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if errors occur communicating with the device.
